meanings.definition: The middle point or part; the center.
meanings.sent1: In the game of tug-of-war, the midmosts of the rope is where both teams pull with equal strength.
meanings.sent2: The midmosts of the forest is often the calmest and most peaceful area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel built its nest right in the midmosts of the tree, enjoying the best view of the surroundings.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like the midmosts of a storm, chaotic yet strangely still.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden in the midmosts of the maze, waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The most central or middle position.
meanings.sent1: The midmosts of the room was adorned with a beautiful chandelier.
meanings.sent2: She placed the vase right in the midmosts of the table for everyone to admire.
meanings.sent3: The midmosts of the cake was decorated with a single candle, making it the focal point of the party.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed from the midmosts of the hall, commanding attention from all.
meanings.sent5: The midmosts of the garden was a serene pond, reflecting the sky above.
